intro: Solms-laubachia tianbaoshanensis, commonly known as the Tianbaoshan spurge, is a rare flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow-orange flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant is typically found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists and conservationists.
